title: The Big Two? This Alcaraz-Sinner rivalry is epic
description: Sinner and Alcaraz have combined to win the last six Grand Slams -- and are pushing each other to new heights in the sport.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Swiakek, Paolini win, Osaka out at Bad Homburg
description: Iga Swiatek and Jasmine Paolini advance to the quarterfinals of the Bad Homburg Open on Tuesday, but American Naomi Osaka fell in straight sets to end her tournament.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Djokovic & Sinner cross paths; Discover more stars training at Wimbledon
description: Novak Djokovic and Jannik Sinner shared a brief embrace Tuesday at Wimbledon while crossing paths on the Aorangi Park practice courts. Many stars are arriving early at the All England Club to prepare for the season’s third major, which begins Monday, 30 June. Sinner practised with Grigor Dimitrov on Tuesday while Djokovic hit with Stefanos Tsitsipas, who is now coached by the Serbian’s former coach Goran Ivanisevic. Djokovic recently clashed against Sinner in a semi-final showing at Roland Garros, where the Italian advanced in straight sets. Sinner, No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings, now leads Djokovic 5-4 in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series. Could their 10th tour-level meeting come at Wimbledon? Scroll down to view photos from Tuesday’s practice sessions. All photo credits belong to Dan Istitene/Getty Images. Jannik Sinner will be the top seed at Wimbledon. Lorenzo Musetti, a semi-finalist last year at SW19, practises on Tuesday. Grigor Dimitrov will be making his 15th appearance at Wimbledon, where he reached the semi-finals in 2014. Novak Djokovic cracks a laugh during his practice session. Goran Ivanisevic, 2001 Wimbledon champion, is now coaching Stefanos Tsitsipas, a partnership that began this month. Wimbledon main-draw actions begins Monday, 30 June. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Djokovic & Ivanisevic back on court... with a twist!
description: Novak Djokovic and Goran Ivanisevic shared a warm reunion Tuesday at Wimbledon. The Serbian — who previously worked with Ivanisevic for six years — was on court practising with Stefanos Tsitsipas, the 2001 Wimbledon champion's newest charge. Djokovic and Tsitsipas were among the stars hitting at Aorangi Park, continuing their preparation for the grass-court major. The 38-year-old Djokovic was coached by Ivanisevic from 2018 until March 2024, working alongside Marian Vajda during the first four years of that span. Tsitsipas, No. 26 in the PIF ATP Rankings, is aiming to regain his best form. He confirmed in May that he would begin working with the former No. 2 Ivanisevic, who was in Halle with the 26-year-old last week. Tsitsipas will look to improve upon his career-best fourth-round appearance (2018, 2023) at Wimbledon, where last year he reached the second round. Goran Ivanisevic and Stefanos Tsitsipas during Tuesday's practice session. Credit: Dan Istitene/Getty Images Meanwhile, Djokovic is seeking to tie Roger Federer’s record of eight Wimbledon crowns. A 100-time tour-level titlist, Djokovic will be making his 20th consecutive appearance at the All England Club (tournament not held in 2020). The 24-time major champion boasts a 97-12 match record at SW19, where he last lifted the trophy in 2022. The past two years Djokovic has fallen to Carlos Alcaraz in the championship match. Both Djokovic and Tsitsipas will learn their place in the draw during the draw ceremony, which will be held on Friday, 27 June at 10 a.m. local time. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Alcaraz Saves 3 Championships Points to Defend Roland Garros Title
description: Carlos Alcaraz clinched his fifth Grand Slam title in a thrilling five-set battle against Jannik Sinner at Roland Garros on Sunday, rallying from two sets down to win 4-6, 6-7(4), 6-4, 7-6(3), 7-6(10-2). The match, the longest Roland Garros final ever at 5 hours and 29 minutes, saw Alcaraz save three championship points in the …
author: Jonathan

title: French Open 2025 Semi Final Recap
description: Day Thirteen at Roland Garros delivered two very different semi-finals, but one clear outcome: the dream final is on. Carlos Alcaraz was the first to book his spot, recovering from a slow start to take control against Lorenzo Musetti, who was forced to retire early in the fourth set due to a leg injury. The …
author: Jonathan

title: Emotional Raducanu battles into Eastbourne second round
description: Emma Raducanu says her emotional reaction to her battling Eastbourne win was because she had received "some really bad news".

title: French star Boisson has Wimbledon hopes ended
description: Breakout Roland Garros star Lois Boisson sees her hopes of a maiden Wimbledon main-draw appearance end in the first round of qualifying.
